oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Letter from Nels Anderson, WPA
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Copy of letter to Myles Horton from WPA, Director of Labor Relations about a "sit-in" at a WPA facility in Tracy City in February 1939. Anderson compliments the protesters for their respectful and peaceful protest and acceptance of the compromised agreement. Anderson avoids taking a stance on the "so-called Crusaders" in Tracy City attacking Highlander's labor work.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Anderson, Nels, 1889-1986
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Labor unions--Organizing--United States; Highlander Folk School (Monteagle, Tenn.); United States. Work Projects Administration; Strikes and lockouts; Civil rights demonstrations; American Federation of Labor; Unemployment; Sit-down strikes
